subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 21, 2007

TOP STORIESGas Prices Set New Record
Gasoline prices climbed to another record Monday, as the average cost of a gallon of regular unleaded rose to $3.19, up from
                        $3.17 on Sunday. Nationwide, the highest average price for regular fuel is $3.59 in Chicago. More...Watch: Gas Prices At All-Time High
• Diabetes Drug Tied To Heart Risk In Study
                     					| Watch• MySpace To Share Sex Offender Data• Lebanon's Fight With Militants Heats UpU.S.Court Sides With Telecoms, Autistic Child
Consumers alleging that phone companies conspired to limit competition lost before the Supreme Court. The court ruled in favor
                        of an Ohio couple seeking to represent their special needs child themselves because they'd run out of money for a lawyer. More...Watch: Court Backs Cops On Chase
• Detroit Fire Kills Pregnant Mom, 3 Kids• Idaho Gunman's Wife Found Dead At Home
                     					| Watch• Midwest Bracing For Cicada Invasion• More StoriesWorldIran Charges U.S. Scholar With Spying
Iran has charged a detained Iranian-American academic with seeking to topple the ruling Islamic establishment. After months
                        of interrogation, Haleh Esfandiari was transferred to a prison with no further communications or visits with her family. More...
• Hamas Strikes Back From Gaza
                     					| Watch• Lebanon's Fight With Militants Heats Up• Historic 19th Century Ship Burns In London
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsJimmy Carter To Bush: Never Mind
Former President Jimmy Carter called his remarks "careless or misinterpreted" when he said the Bush administration was the
                        "worst in history" for its impact around the world. Mr. Carter said he only meant to compare President Bush with Nixon. More...Watch: Carter Bashes Bush
• Fla. Moves Presidential Primary To Jan. 29
                     					| Watch• Bill Richardson Makes It Official
                     					| Watch• Bush: Gonzales "Has Done Nothing Wrong"
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthStatins May Cut Prostate Cancer Deaths
Researchers say there may be a surprising reason for the ongoing decline in U.S. prostate cancer deaths: increased use of
                        cholesterol-lowering statin drugs. More...
• N.J. May Give Pet Owners Right To Sue• Diabetes Drug Tied To Heart Risk In Study
                     					| Watch• When "Senior Moments" Begin
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechMidwest Bracing For Cicada Invasion
The Midwest is about to get noisy. "Brood XIII", the next generation of the 17 year cicada, is about to take over the trees,
                        air and ground. Dogs have a big snack to come, but some outdoor events planners have a major headache on their hands. More...
• MySpace To Share Sex Offender Data• Wayward Whales Headed Back To Sea
                     					| Watch• Alltel Acquired For $27.5B• More StoriesBusinessLess Bang For Your Buck In Europe
The dollar has fallen 5 percent so far this year against the euro and the pound. That's equivalent to a 20 percent annual
                        decline. It could be good for the trade deficit, but bad for anyone who buys foreign products or travels abroad. More...
• S&P 500 Ventures Into Record Territory• Alltel Acquired For $27.5B• James Dyson Keeps Innovating• More StoriesEntertainmentBrangelina Takes On Cannes
Angelina Jolie, Marianne Pearl and Brad Pitt, the movie's co-producer, were at the Cannes Film Festival on Monday for the
                        premiere of "A Mighty Heart," about Daniel Pearl's abduction and murder in Pakistan in 2002. More...Watch: Brangelina Arrives At Cannes
• Garrison Pleads Guilty In Fatal Crash
                     					| Watch• Yeah Boyeeee! Flavor Flav Roast Announced• Three Could Be Charm Twice For Bloom
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionThompson Doing Things His Way
Fred Thompson wasn't at last week's Republican presidential debate, but he still managed to be relevant, the Weekly Standard
                        says, thanks to the former senator's innovative pre-campaign strategy. More...Watch: Republicans Take Jabs
• Jimmy Carter's Cutting Words
                     					| Watch• John And Rudy's New York Revue
                     					| Watch• Andy Pays A Visit To The Book Fair• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Celeb Spot: Three Could Be Charm Twice For Bloom
The third movie in the "Pirates" trilogy comes out this week, to go along with his "Lord of the Rings" trilogy. "Pirates of
                        the Caribbean: At World's End" is expected to rack up the same mega-numbers its predecessors did. More...Watch: Bloom's 'Pirate' Success

Lebanon Battles MilitantsLebanese troops exchanged fire with militants in the northern city of Tripoli after laying siege to a Palestinian refugee
                                    camp suspected of being a militant stronghold. Charlie D'Agata reports.
